Package core

Interface HlaInteractionManager

  • public interface HlaInteractionManager
    Manager used to manage all interactions.

    This class is ThreadSafe as defined by Java Concurrency in Practice, see jcip.net.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface Description
      static interface  HlaInteractionManager.HlaHLAinteractionRootInteraction
      Interface for creating a HlaHLAinteractionRootInteraction

      Interface for creating a HlaModeTransitionRequestInteraction
      static interface  HlaInteractionManager.HlaModeTransitionRequestParameters
      Interface for getting HLAinteractionRoot.ModeTransitionRequest parameters
      static interface  HlaInteractionManager.HlaStartStopInteraction
      Interface for creating a HlaStartStopInteraction
      static class  HlaInteractionManager.Interaction
      An enumeration of all interactions.

      • sendHLAinteractionRoot

        void sendHLAinteractionRoot()
                     throws HlaNotConnectedException,
                            HlaFomException,
                            HlaInternalException,
                            HlaRtiException,
                            HlaSaveInProgressException,
                            HlaRestoreInProgressException
        Sends the HLAinteractionRoot interaction.
        Throws:
        HlaNotConnectedException - if the federate is not connected
        HlaFomException - if the FOM is invalid
        HlaInternalException - on internal errors
        HlaRtiException - on exception from the RTI
        HlaSaveInProgressException - if a federation save is in progress
        HlaRestoreInProgressException - if a federation restore is in progress

      • sendModeTransitionRequest

        void sendModeTransitionRequest​(MTRMode executionMode)
                        throws HlaNotConnectedException,
                               HlaFomException,
                               HlaInternalException,
                               HlaRtiException,
                               HlaSaveInProgressException,
                               HlaRestoreInProgressException
        Sends the HLAinteractionRoot.ModeTransitionRequest interaction.
        Parameters:
        executionMode - represents the execution_mode from the FOM.
        Description from the FOM: The run mode requested. There are only 3 valid Mode Transition Request (MTR) mode values: MTR_GOTO_RUN, MTR_GOTO_FREEZE, MTR_GOTO_SHUTDOWN. Of these three valid mode requests, only 7 combinations of current execution mode and requested mode are valid: 1. EXEC_MODE_UNINITIALIZED -> EXEC_MODE_SHUTDOWN 2. EXEC_MODE_INITIALIZED -> EXEC_MODE_FREEZE 3. EXEC_MODE_INITIALIZED -> EXEC_MODE_SHUTDOWN 4. EXEC_MODE_RUNNING -> EXEC_MODE_FREEZE 5. EXEC_MODE_RUNNING -> EXEC_MODE_SHUTDOWN 6. EXEC_MODE_FREEZE -> EXEC_MODE_RUNNING 7. EXEC_MODE_FREEZE -> EXEC_MODE_SHUTDOWN
        Description of the data type from the FOM: Mode Transition Request (MTR) transition values. This enumeration is used to request a specific mode transition. However, not all mode transition requests are accepted for any given Run Mode. See mode transition validation table in the Space Reference FOM documentation.
        Throws:
        HlaNotConnectedException - if the federate is not connected
        HlaFomException - if the FOM is invalid
        HlaInternalException - on internal errors
        HlaRtiException - on exception from the RTI
        HlaSaveInProgressException - if a federation save is in progress
        HlaRestoreInProgressException - if a federation restore is in progress

      • sendModeTransitionRequest

        void sendModeTransitionRequest​(MTRMode executionMode,
                               HlaTimeStamp timeStamp)
                        throws HlaNotConnectedException,
                               HlaFomException,
                               HlaInternalException,
                               HlaRtiException,
                               HlaSaveInProgressException,
                               HlaRestoreInProgressException
        Sends the HLAinteractionRoot.ModeTransitionRequest interaction with a specified timestamp.
        Parameters:
        executionMode - represents the execution_mode from the FOM.
        Description from the FOM: The run mode requested. There are only 3 valid Mode Transition Request (MTR) mode values: MTR_GOTO_RUN, MTR_GOTO_FREEZE, MTR_GOTO_SHUTDOWN. Of these three valid mode requests, only 7 combinations of current execution mode and requested mode are valid: 1. EXEC_MODE_UNINITIALIZED -> EXEC_MODE_SHUTDOWN 2. EXEC_MODE_INITIALIZED -> EXEC_MODE_FREEZE 3. EXEC_MODE_INITIALIZED -> EXEC_MODE_SHUTDOWN 4. EXEC_MODE_RUNNING -> EXEC_MODE_FREEZE 5. EXEC_MODE_RUNNING -> EXEC_MODE_SHUTDOWN 6. EXEC_MODE_FREEZE -> EXEC_MODE_RUNNING 7. EXEC_MODE_FREEZE -> EXEC_MODE_SHUTDOWN
        Description of the data type from the FOM: Mode Transition Request (MTR) transition values. This enumeration is used to request a specific mode transition. However, not all mode transition requests are accepted for any given Run Mode. See mode transition validation table in the Space Reference FOM documentation.
        timeStamp - timestamp to send for this interaction
        Throws:
        HlaNotConnectedException - if the federate is not connected
        HlaFomException - if the FOM is invalid
        HlaInternalException - on internal errors
        HlaRtiException - on exception from the RTI
        HlaSaveInProgressException - if a federation save is in progress
        HlaRestoreInProgressException - if a federation restore is in progress

      • sendModeTransitionRequest

        void sendModeTransitionRequest​(MTRMode executionMode,
                               HlaLogicalTime logicalTime)
                        throws HlaNotConnectedException,
                               HlaFomException,
                               HlaInvalidLogicalTimeException,
                               HlaInternalException,
                               HlaRtiException,
                               HlaSaveInProgressException,
                               HlaRestoreInProgressException
        Sends the HLAinteractionRoot.ModeTransitionRequest interaction with a specified logical time.
        Parameters:
        executionMode - represents the execution_mode from the FOM.
        Description from the FOM: The run mode requested. There are only 3 valid Mode Transition Request (MTR) mode values: MTR_GOTO_RUN, MTR_GOTO_FREEZE, MTR_GOTO_SHUTDOWN. Of these three valid mode requests, only 7 combinations of current execution mode and requested mode are valid: 1. EXEC_MODE_UNINITIALIZED -> EXEC_MODE_SHUTDOWN 2. EXEC_MODE_INITIALIZED -> EXEC_MODE_FREEZE 3. EXEC_MODE_INITIALIZED -> EXEC_MODE_SHUTDOWN 4. EXEC_MODE_RUNNING -> EXEC_MODE_FREEZE 5. EXEC_MODE_RUNNING -> EXEC_MODE_SHUTDOWN 6. EXEC_MODE_FREEZE -> EXEC_MODE_RUNNING 7. EXEC_MODE_FREEZE -> EXEC_MODE_SHUTDOWN
        Description of the data type from the FOM: Mode Transition Request (MTR) transition values. This enumeration is used to request a specific mode transition. However, not all mode transition requests are accepted for any given Run Mode. See mode transition validation table in the Space Reference FOM documentation.
        logicalTime - logical time to send for this interaction
        Throws:
        HlaNotConnectedException - if the federate is not connected
        HlaFomException - if the FOM is invalid
        HlaInvalidLogicalTimeException - if the logical time is invalid
        HlaInternalException - on internal errors
        HlaRtiException - on exception from the RTI
        HlaSaveInProgressException - if a federation save is in progress
        HlaRestoreInProgressException - if a federation restore is in progress

      • sendModeTransitionRequest

        void sendModeTransitionRequest​(MTRMode executionMode,
                               HlaTimeStamp timeStamp,
                               HlaLogicalTime logicalTime)
                        throws HlaNotConnectedException,
                               HlaFomException,
                               HlaInvalidLogicalTimeException,
                               HlaInternalException,
                               HlaRtiException,
                               HlaSaveInProgressException,
                               HlaRestoreInProgressException
        Sends the HLAinteractionRoot.ModeTransitionRequest interaction with a specified timestamp and logical time.
        Parameters:
        executionMode - represents the execution_mode from the FOM.
        Description from the FOM: The run mode requested. There are only 3 valid Mode Transition Request (MTR) mode values: MTR_GOTO_RUN, MTR_GOTO_FREEZE, MTR_GOTO_SHUTDOWN. Of these three valid mode requests, only 7 combinations of current execution mode and requested mode are valid: 1. EXEC_MODE_UNINITIALIZED -> EXEC_MODE_SHUTDOWN 2. EXEC_MODE_INITIALIZED -> EXEC_MODE_FREEZE 3. EXEC_MODE_INITIALIZED -> EXEC_MODE_SHUTDOWN 4. EXEC_MODE_RUNNING -> EXEC_MODE_FREEZE 5. EXEC_MODE_RUNNING -> EXEC_MODE_SHUTDOWN 6. EXEC_MODE_FREEZE -> EXEC_MODE_RUNNING 7. EXEC_MODE_FREEZE -> EXEC_MODE_SHUTDOWN
        Description of the data type from the FOM: Mode Transition Request (MTR) transition values. This enumeration is used to request a specific mode transition. However, not all mode transition requests are accepted for any given Run Mode. See mode transition validation table in the Space Reference FOM documentation.
        timeStamp - timestamp to send for this interaction
        logicalTime - logical time to send for this interaction
        Throws:
        HlaNotConnectedException - if the federate is not connected
        HlaFomException - if the FOM is invalid
        HlaInvalidLogicalTimeException - if the logical time is invalid
        HlaInternalException - on internal errors
        HlaRtiException - on exception from the RTI
        HlaSaveInProgressException - if a federation save is in progress
        HlaRestoreInProgressException - if a federation restore is in progress

      • addHlaInteractionListener

        void addHlaInteractionListener​(HlaInteractionListener listener)
        Add a interaction listener.
        Parameters:

        void removeHlaInteractionListener​(HlaInteractionListener listener)
        Remove a interaction listener.
        Parameters:
        listener - listener to remove

      • setEnabled

        void setEnabled​(boolean enabled,
                HlaInteractionManager.Interaction interaction)
        Enables or disables an interaction. The interaction is enabled by default. The state can only be changed when not connected. When an interaction is disabled it will act as disconnected, ie throws HlaNotConnectedException.
        Parameters:
        enabled - true to enable the interaction, otherwise false
        interaction - the interaction to change

      • setEnabled

        void setEnabled​(boolean enabled,
                java.util.Set<HlaInteractionManager.Interaction> interactions)
        Enables or disables a set of interactions. The interactions are enabled by default. The state can only be changed when not connected. When an interaction is disabled it will act as disconnected, ie throws HlaNotConnectedException.
        Parameters:
        enabled - true to enable the interactions, otherwise false
        interactions - the interactions to change

      • setEnabledIfAvailableInFom

        void setEnabledIfAvailableInFom​(java.util.Set<HlaInteractionManager.Interaction> interactions)
        Enables a set of interactions if they are available in the FOM at runtime. The interactions are enabled by default. The state can only be changed when not connected. When an interaction is disabled it will act as disconnected, ie throws HlaNotConnectedException.
        Parameters:
        interactions - the interactions to change

      • isEnabled

        boolean isEnabled​(HlaInteractionManager.Interaction interaction)
        Check if an interaction is actually enabled when connected. An interaction may be disabled with the setEnabled(false, ...) function, or it may be configured as if available in the FOM by the setEnabledIfAvailableInFom(...) function and then not available in the FOM at runtime.

        This method should only be used when connected, it will always return false when not connected.

        Parameters:
        interaction - the interaction to check
        Returns:
        true if connected and the interaction is enabled.
